content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function with third derivative <math alttext="f triple prime of x, equals, open parenthesis, 4 x, plus 1, close parenthesis, raised to the three halves power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the coefficient of <math alttext="open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math> in the fourth-degree Taylor polynomial for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> about <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
